text: Confession: my uncle (god father, actually) spent a summer traveling & collecting hot dogs from major baseball fields & shellacking them to be preserved later. As one was drying on the front yard our dog peewee ate it whole. I recalled this story in a meeting today & felt it should be shared.
There are a lot of amazing things there
I'm proud to know someone with such a rich past

Confession: when I was 3, I stole an entire case of Thin Mint girl scout cookies from my sister, dragged them out in the yard, into the bushes, and ate one box. Then I threw up and left the case there. My mom paid for the case and I was not allowed to do girl scouts.

When I was about 6 I was in ballet & I wanted to impress with how high I could kick. I ended up kicking so high up I fell backwards, on stage, in front of about 100 people. My dad has it on a VHS somewhere.
At the end, we were all waving & I was in the front & didnâ€™t notice everyone leaving. I was left waving, until I ran off realizing nobody else was around me.
